result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven L Burton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes:
02-12-16/ Judge Michelle Havas
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 60 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC.

STAYED; for the use at the discretion of the probation department

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven L Burton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amended JOC reflects 02-12-16 Court order imposing   60   days of condition time

Defendant Steven L Burton not in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Agent in court, defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 60 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.
No reply from defendant/surety.  sb
Added DV surcharge/additional warrant fee
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Steven L Burton in court with Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Steven L Burton in custody.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 7  MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for 18 days served.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- Court ordered 60 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Successfully complete an Anger Management program
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety
- No contact with the victim without the approval of the Court or the probation agent
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on February 12, 2016.

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Steven L Burton in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Steven L Burton in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS to count 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
AS to counts 1 and 3, court orders counts dismissed and read in for sentencing.  Defendant remanded pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Steven L Burton not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to modify bail is DENIED
Case set for plea/sentencing on 9-28-2015.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.
No Contact Order REMAINS IN EFFECT.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY ORDER.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. 

No Contact with Bobbie J.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
